name: Halflings
background:
Halflings are short Humans, smaller than your typical Dwarf. They lack the heavy weaponry of some species, instead relying on inventive uses of technology, animals, and pacts made with spirits and golems. 

After facing many perils, they are a people torn between two lives that now struggle to reconcile them. They were driven from their idyllic farmland homes by marauding Giants, and after generations of conflict and struggle, they have made their way back to their ancient homeland. Yet now, many Halflings find themselves at odds with their old traditions, preferring instead to pursue their ancient grudge against the Giants.
backgroundFull:
Halflings originally resided north of the Western Steppe, where their clans built villages and farmed in peace for many centuries. This changed when Giants appeared, marauding through their homeland. The Giants ate any livestock, grain, and Halflings they encountered along the way, taking little note of any resistance the villages could muster. Without any means to defend themselves, the Halflings evacuated their homelands, fleeing through a hidden Voidgate. They hoped to return once the danger had passed, only to discover that the Giants had destroyed the gate, preventing them from returning home. 

The Halfings arrived in a land of rocky hills and bogs, ill suited to the sort of farming that had once been their way of life. They grew what little the land would allow them, farming mushrooms and resilient plants, while hunting and fishing to make up the rest. They struggled to survive during these difficult times, and many died of starvation and cold.‍

The Halflings encountered Havoc’s influence in the North before most, and without anywhere left to escape to, the Halflings fought to defend their new home, adapting their old farming equipment and animals to war. Their army proved versatile and adaptable, despite their ragtag appearance. While many Halflings would die during the war, those who survived became skilled warriors, specialising in combat against larger foes. 

Once the Havoc Wars ended, many Halfling veterans decided to go south and seek revenge on the Giants. They marched through the lands which Havoc had destroyed until they arrived in their old homeland. The tribe of Giants who had destroyed their home had long moved on and perhaps even died out, but the Halflings still sought out and fought with any other Giants that they could find. Secure in their old homeland, the veteran Halflings rebuilt the old Voidgate. The eldest Halfling recognised their ruined homes, but few still wished to return. Most Halflings now remain in their new Northern home, only returning to their home countries in order to hunt Giants. 

The return of Havoc gives the Halflings another ancestral foe to prove themselves against. Many Halfling clans still hold grudges for ancestors killed during the Havoc Wars and are eager to prove their skills against them. 

How will you settle your ancestral grudges?

spells.name: Luck of the Ancients
spells.effect: Pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets Lucky Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Cleansing Spirit
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with AP(1) and Bash.

spells.name: Giant Shadow
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which get -1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? this.getMoraleCost({ ...unit, quality: Math.max(1, unit.quality - params.effect.rollModifier.value) }) - this.getMoraleCost(unit) : 0

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value }) - this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Nightmare Spirit
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 6 hits.

spells.name: Shortling Courage
spells.effect: Pick up to three friendly units within 12", which get Fearless once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Dark Forest Spirit
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 6", which takes 3 hits with AP(2) and Deadly(3).

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Swift
specialRules.description: This model may ignore the Slow rule.

specialRules.name: Takedown Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, when it's this model's turn to attack in melee, you may pick one model in the unit as its target, and make one attack at Quality 2+ with AP(2) and Deadly(3), which is resolved as if it's a unit of 1.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Heavy Impact
specialRules.description: Counts as having Impact(X) with hits that have AP(1).

specialRules.name: Crossing Barrage
specialRules.description: Once per activation, when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them and roll X dice. For each 4+ it takes 3 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Precision Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get +1 to hit rolls in melee.

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Lucky
specialRules.description: When attacking, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Rending when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Rending when shooting.

specialRules.name: Regeneration Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Teleport Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Teleport.

specialRules.name: Bane in Melee
specialRules.description: This model gets Bane in melee.

specialRules.name: Bounding
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within D3+1" of their position.

specialRules.name: Lucky Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Lucky Boost.

specialRules.name: Vengeance
specialRules.description: When this unit is fully destroyed, place as many Vengeance markers on the unit that destroyed it as models with this rule in this unit at the beginning of the game. Friendly units get +X to hit rolls with their weapons when attacking that unit, where X is the number of markers on it.

specialRules.name: Morale Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which gets -1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Surprise Attack
specialRules.description: Counts as having Infiltrate. Once deployed via this rule, roll X dice, for each 4+ one enemy unit within 3” takes 2 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Good Fighter
specialRules.description: This model gets +1 to hit rolls in melee.

specialRules.name: Bash
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and against units where most models have Defense 5+ to Defense 6+, this weapon gets Blast(+3).

specialRules.name: Rending in Melee
specialRules.description: This model gets Rending in melee.

specialRules.name: Slow
specialRules.description: Moves -2" when using Advance, and -4” when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Impact
specialRules.description: Roll X dice when attacking after charging, unless fatigued. For each 2+ the target takes one hit.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model must take X wounds before being killed. If a model with tough joins a unit without it, then it is removed last when the unit takes wounds. You must continue to put wounds on the tough model with most wounds in the unit until it is killed, before starting to put them on the next tough model (heroes must be assigned wounds last, even if already wounded).

specialRules.name: Rending
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Teleport
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, place this model anywhere fully within 6" of its position.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Lucky Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Lucky, it deals extra hits on successful unmodified hit results of 5-6 from Lucky (instead of only on 6).

specialRules.name: Infiltrate
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, but may be deployed up to 1" away from enemy units.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as models in the target unit.

specialRules.name: Fearless
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule fails a morale test, roll one die. On a 4+ it counts as passed instead.
